intro: Cynoglossum suavifolium, commonly known as sweetleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, which is characterized by its showy flowers and often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are blue to violet in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems, and bloom from late summer into early fall. The plant prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
